CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C02

TI_TEXT.P: Servicii de învăţământ şi formare profesională

SHORT_DESCR.P: YPO are looking for providers to be appointed onto a Framework Agreement for the provision of Apprenticeship Standards and Associated Training. The Framework is designed to meet the needs of all public sector organisations which includes YPO’s internal requirements. This framework is being procured under the Light Touch Regime (LTR) and therefore subject to the limited regulation and will be conducted in accordance with regulations 74 to 76 PCR2015.
The Framework period will be: 1.8.2018 to 31.7.2020 with two options to extend for an additional 12 months (2+2).
Each lot is broken down into 3 tiers. Tier 1 is the region, tier 2 is the apprenticeship route and tier 3 is the apprenticeship standard.
A list of the tier 3 standards can be found on the following link, as well as within the tender documents: https://www.instituteforapprenticeships.org/apprenticeship-standards/

This framework will be re-opened on a quarterly basis first year of the framework and on a six monthly basis for the remainder of the framework to allow for new suppliers in the market to bid to be a part of the framework agreement and to allow YPO to add/amend any new standards that are approved. Suppliers who are already on the framework agreement can re-submit a bid for the new standards. If YPO feel that these timescales don’t run in-line with market changes we will give a months notice to amend these time periods. The apprenticeship market is changing and developing across all of the public sector and YPO want to ensure that we can meet the needs of both providers and customers.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: There is a possibility that the framework will be subject to renewal after 3.5 years from commencement date, if the optional extension is taken.

SUITABILITY.P: Organisations must ensure that they are not in breach of any of the mandatory or discretionary exclusions contained in Regulation 57 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015. Please refer to the Tender Documentation/ Online Tender located on our E-Procurement system. The web address can be found under ‘Procurement Documents’ in ‘Communication’ section in this notice.

ESTIMATED_TIMING.P: There is a possibility that this framework will be subject to renewal after 3.5 years from the commencement date, if the optional extension is taken.

INFO_ADD.P: YPO are purchasing on the behalf of other contracting authorities. Please see the below link for details: https://www.ypo.co.uk/about/customers/ojeu-permissible-users.aspx

YPO will incorporate a standstill period at the point of notification of the award of the contract is provided to all bidders. The standstill period will be for a minimum of 10 calendar days, and provides time for unsuccessful tenderers to challenge the award decision before the contract is entered into. The Public Contracts Regulations 2015 provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (England, Wales and Northern Ireland).

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: High Court of England and Wales
